critique: This document appears to be an instruction regarding land sales in Hawaii following the Resolution of Annexation. It aims to halt the sale of public lands by the Hawaiian government and invalidate any sales made after the annexation resolution. This seems to be about asserting federal control over territory acquired by the US. There's no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, or emphasis on national security vs. civil liberties. It does centralize power in the federal government, potentially impacting economic regulation and social inclusion depending on how the land was intended to be used or distributed.
